intro: Loudetiopsis glabrata, commonly known as the smooth lichen, is a species of lichen that belongs to the family Lichenes. It is characterized by its dense, crust-like growth form and is typically found on rock surfaces in arid or semi-arid environments. The thallus of Loudetiopsis glabrata is usually pale to dark brown in color and lacks distinct lobes or cracks. It is a symbiotic organism composed of a fungal partner and a photosynthetic partner, usually a green alga or cyanobacterium. This lichen is often used as an indicator species for environmental conditions due to its sensitivity to air pollution.
